notes: Table 2 Col 1: time FE only (no reactor FE) with no age controls. Alternative baseline from paper build-up table rather than a robustness test of the main specification.
Table 2 Col 2: reactor + time FE but no age controls. Alternative baseline from paper build-up table rather than a robustness test of the main specification.
Table 2 Col 3 replication: reactor + time FE with age^2 and age^3 controls clustered at plant level. Coefficient=10.007 se=2.060 p<0.0001 N=36667.

Table 2 Col 5: plant-level aggregation. Changes unit of analysis from reactor to plant creating fractional treatment values for multi-reactor plants. Coefficient=-9.60 (insignificant) due to attenuation from averaging.
No fixed effects with age controls. Tests sensitivity to FE structure. Coefficient=14.20 significant.
Reactor FE only (no time FE). Tests sensitivity to FE structure. Coefficient=11.18 significant.
Time FE only (no reactor FE) with age controls. Tests sensitivity to FE structure. Coefficient=6.04 significant.
Reactor + year FE (coarser time FE than baseline year-month). Tests sensitivity to FE granularity. Coefficient=10.05 significant.
Plant + time FE (coarser unit FE than baseline reactor). Tests sensitivity to unit FE granularity. Coefficient=9.93 significant.
No age controls. Tests sensitivity to polynomial age controls. Coefficient=10.22 significant.
Age^2 only (no cubic). Tests sensitivity to age control polynomial order. Coefficient=10.14 significant.
Add capacity as control. Tests sensitivity to additional controls. Coefficient=10.01 significant (identical to baseline since capacity is time-invariant and absorbed by reactor FE).
Add same_owner consolidation measure as control. Tests whether divestiture effect operates through consolidation channel. Coefficient=7.67 significant.
Cluster at reactor level (finer than baseline plant clustering). Coefficient=10.01 SE=1.62 significant.
Cluster at state level. Coefficient=10.01 SE=1.88 significant.
Cluster at NRC region level (very few clusters). Coefficient=10.01 SE=2.10 p=0.017 significant at 5%.
Heteroskedasticity-robust SEs (no clustering). Coefficient=10.01 SE=0.60 highly significant.
Exclude California reactors. Coefficient=9.55 significant.
Exclude Michigan reactors. Coefficient=10.27 significant.
Exclude Illinois reactors (large nuclear state). Coefficient=8.59 significant.
Exclude New York reactors. Coefficient=9.56 significant.
Exclude Pennsylvania reactors. Coefficient=10.44 significant.
Exclude New Jersey reactors. Coefficient=10.06 significant.
Exclude Connecticut reactors. Coefficient=9.90 significant.
Exclude Iowa and Wisconsin reactors. Coefficient=10.12 significant.
Exclude Northeast region. Coefficient=9.89 significant.
Exclude Midwest region. Coefficient=7.39 significant.
Exclude South region. Coefficient=14.43 significant.
Exclude West region. Coefficient=9.44 significant.
Exclude Northeast and West regions. Coefficient=9.21 significant.
Treatment redefined as post-2001 divestitures only. Coefficient=7.65 significant.
Post-1990 sample. Coefficient=12.01 significant.
Post-1995 sample. Coefficient=13.70 significant.
Post-2000 sample. Coefficient=9.01 significant.
Pre-2005 sample. Coefficient=8.94 significant.
Drop 1996-1998 transitional period. Coefficient=8.63 significant.
Drop 10 long-outage reactors. Coefficient=8.10 significant.
PWR type x divested interaction. Tests heterogeneity by reactor type. Coefficient=9.37 significant. Different treatment variable (divtypePWR) measuring a subgroup effect.
BWR type x divested interaction. Tests heterogeneity by reactor type. Coefficient=10.65 significant. Different treatment variable (divtypeBWR) measuring a subgroup effect.
Westinghouse manufacturer x divested interaction. Coefficient=9.92 significant. Different treatment variable (divmanfWE).
GE manufacturer x divested interaction. Coefficient=10.62 significant. Different treatment variable (divmanfGE).
CE manufacturer x divested interaction. Coefficient=5.73 NOT significant (p=0.10). Different treatment variable (divmanfCE). Small subsample.
B&W manufacturer x divested interaction. Coefficient=12.33 significant. Different treatment variable (divmanfBW).
Pre-1975 vintage x divested interaction. Coefficient=10.13 significant. Different treatment variable (divV75).
1975-84 vintage x divested interaction. Coefficient=13.46 significant. Different treatment variable (divV85).
1985+ vintage x divested interaction. Coefficient=7.06 significant. Different treatment variable (divV95).
External sale x divested interaction. Coefficient=11.35 significant. Different treatment variable (divsale).
Internal transfer x divested interaction. Coefficient=9.22 significant. Different treatment variable (divtransfer).
High wholesale price region x divested interaction. Coefficient=9.37 significant. Different treatment variable (divpriceHI).
Low wholesale price region x divested interaction. Coefficient=10.96 significant. Different treatment variable (divpriceLO).

Controlling for same_owner consolidation measure. Tests whether divestiture effect survives after controlling for consolidation. Coefficient=7.67 significant. Duplicate of robust/control/add_same_owner.
Coefficient on same_owner (not divested). Different treatment variable testing consolidation channel directly. Not a robustness check of divestiture effect.
With same_type consolidation control. Coefficient=8.61 significant.
With same_manuf consolidation control. Coefficient=8.60 significant.
Never-divested reactors only with same_owner as treatment. Different treatment variable (same_owner) and different subsample. Tests consolidation effect in non-divested plants.
Log(power+1) as outcome. Coefficient=0.36 significant. Different scale but same direction.
Binary outcome: power > 80%. Coefficient=0.091 significant. 9.1 pp increase in probability of exceeding 80% threshold.
Binary outcome: power > 90%. Coefficient=0.091 significant. 9.1 pp increase in probability of exceeding 90% threshold.
Generation (MWh) as outcome. Coefficient=70763 significant. Divestiture increases monthly generation by ~71 GWh.
Month=January only regression. Coefficient=9.19 significant. Tests seasonal heterogeneity not robustness of pooled estimate.
Month=February only regression. Coefficient=10.59 significant.
Month=March only regression. Coefficient=9.41 significant (p=0.018).
Month=April only regression. Coefficient=9.36 significant (p=0.007).
Month=May only regression. Coefficient=14.50 significant. Largest effect (refueling season).
Month=June only regression. Coefficient=12.40 significant.
Month=July only regression. Coefficient=7.26 significant.
Month=August only regression. Coefficient=7.42 significant.
Month=September only regression. Coefficient=7.89 significant.
Month=October only regression. Coefficient=8.42 significant (p=0.014).
Month=November only regression. Coefficient=13.74 significant.
Month=December only regression. Coefficient=9.47 significant.
BWR reactors only subsample. Coefficient=0.92 NOT significant (p=0.82). Very few divested BWR reactors.
PWR reactors only subsample. Coefficient=11.95 significant.
GE reactors only subsample. Coefficient=0.92 NOT significant (p=0.82). Identical to BWR_only (all GE reactors are BWR).
Westinghouse reactors only subsample. Coefficient=11.48 significant.
Pre-1975 vintage subsample. Coefficient=13.34 significant.
1975-84 vintage subsample. Coefficient=8.63 NOT significant (p=0.10). Marginal.
1985+ vintage subsample. Coefficient=9.44 significant.
NRC region 1 subsample. Coefficient=6.52 NOT significant at 5% (p=0.092). Marginal.
NRC region 3 subsample. Coefficient=14.33 significant.
NRC region 4 subsample. Coefficient=6.52 significant (p=0.028).
Drop negative capacity factors. Coefficient=5.18 significant.
Winsorize at 1st/99th percentiles. Coefficient=9.89 significant.
Drop capacity factors above 100%. Coefficient=7.90 significant.
Linear time trend replacing time FE. Coefficient=11.13 significant.
Quadratic time trend replacing time FE. Coefficient=10.87 significant.
